title.native: 夢王国と眠れる100人の王子様
title.romaji: Yume Oukoku to Nemureru 100-nin no Ouji-sama
title.english: 100 Sleeping Princes & the Kingdom of Dreams

description:
The heroine is an ordinary, everyday woman until the day she finds herself in another world and discovers that she’s actually a long-lost princess. Now, she must enlist the aid of the world of dreams’ princes and defend against the onslaught of nightmarish monsters known only as the dream-eaters.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Pirates
tags.description: Prominently features sea-faring adventurers branded as criminals by the law.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Mermaid
tags.description: A mythological creature with the body of a human and the tail of a fish.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

title.native: 夢王国と眠れる100人の王子様 Shorts

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋ナツコ)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/193091/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/331643934) | [Website](http://mazurka.moo.jp/)

While studying for a university degree in art, she was discovered by web artists [Shingo Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/114914/) and [Kenichi Kutsuna](https://anilist.co/staff/116007/), who recruited her to work on [Birdy Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/). She did not join any particular studio, but started her career as a freelancer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KoudenMS)

Masafumi Takada is a japanese composer and sound designer best known for his work on the soundtracks for killer7, God Hand, No More Heroes, and the Earth Defense Force and the Danganronpa series.
Miu Miyamoto is an art director and background artist.

moumoon is a Japanese pop duo consisting of two members: vocalist and lyricist Yuka and composer Kousuke Masaki. Formed in 2005, the duo signed with Gate Records in 2006, and released their debut single "Flowers/Pride", and mini-album Flowers that September. In 2007, they left Gate Records and signed with Avex Trax, releasing their second mini-album, Love Me? in August. The duo's name is a combination of the French "Mou" and the English "Moon", together meaning "Soft Moon"

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.
